2017-07-15 19:44:06.text: <@U5ZSUKV6C> i lived there the first month of school. location is great, the open areas upstairs and downstairs are great. generally pretty clean but lots of bugs - cockroaches in the kitchen area that they can't get rid of (it's neighboring a popular bar). everyone is basically packed in one space (like military style bunk beds) because the building is a commercial building they makeshifted into a living area. The people are very very interesting and there are definitely lots of founders/entreprenuers/programmers/bootcampers there that all have big dreams so you'll have a lot to talk about. I used to stay up pretty late having really interesting convos with all of them.

2017-08-20 20:12:16.text:
I'll ping <@U6DJVN0TV> for this if you're also looking here. Here's my general review:

Buildings on TI are older, neighborhoods are OK, not really sketchy by any means, but not like... nice. There's a grocery store and a little convenience store shack thingy and that's about it. One upside is there's a lot of street parking, one downside is that you cannot get to the city without taking the bus/driving a vehicle. The bus comes "every" 15 during the day and "every" 30 at night, 24/7, but I've had to wait an hour for it to show up before. Traffic on the bridge blows almost 24/7.

Kinda big caveat: the buildings are all on a list for being removed, so you might one day get 30 days notice to leave so they can bulldoze your house. Chances are this won't happen for a couple years. 

...also there's high levels of radiation and heavy metal poisoning in the soil which is why there's a bunch of houses that got boarded up && fenced off and have gigantic warning signs. Like I've had government dudes with geiger counters in my lawn.

2017-08-20 20:06:41.text: There's a few students on TI, lmk if you need anything/have any questions

2017-07-10 23:52:33.text: <@U66482V33> it's not bad. they clean bathrooms every day and you have sheets replaced every 2 weeks. it's also about a 25 min walk from school, all one street so pretty convenient

2017-07-15 19:45:32.text: So depending on what you're looking for it may or may not be worth the price (when I was there I was told I could only get the student discount $1080 for 3 months and after it would go up to $1200). I'm staying at SFSH right now and paying $605/month.

2017-07-21 03:30:38.text: Yeah I doubt you'd need to worry. Lotta consoles and stuff around.

2017-08-21 19:09:29.text: Wow my dad works in that field, is the poisoning due to a dumpsite? Thanks for the rundown of TI

2017-07-21 19:30:05.text: Hi Jacob! I don’t recommend it. The $9 adds up and also if you have to drive to bart, the parking is not only expensive but also hard to get prior to 6:30am. Also its not rare to have late nights here and the last train is at midnight, if you miss it you’re stuck out here. To be honest, once you start school you basically just go home to shower, change clothes, and occasionally sleep lol. Might as well have something more convenient.
